intro: Cieca difformis, commonly known as the irregular bladderwort, is a unique aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its specialized bladder-like structures used for trapping small aquatic organisms. These bladders are typically filled with air and can expand to capture prey, aiding in nutrient absorption. The plant is often found in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats. Its morphology and carnivorous adaptations make it an intriguing subject in botanical studies.
